topic_rationale: This topic is an important example of drug-drug interaction leading to a potentially dangerous condition. It is educational because it shows how medications can interact and emphasizes the importance of a thorough medication review.

explanations.tile_0: Hyperreflexia is a common sign of serotonin syndrome, caused by excess serotonin in the CNS.
explanations.tile_1: Serotonin syndrome is often caused by the use of drugs that increase the level of serotonin, such as SSRIs.
explanations.tile_2: Clonus (rapid involuntary muscle contraction and relaxation) is a characteristic feature of serotonin syndrome.
explanations.tile_3: Excessive sweating can occur in serotonin syndrome due to overactivation of the autonomic nervous system.
explanations.tile_4: Tremors can be a common sign of serotonin syndrome, reflecting CNS excitation.
explanations.tile_5: Adding tramadol (which has serotonergic activity) to an SSRI regimen can increase the risk of serotonin syndrome.
explanations.tile_6: Dilated pupils (mydriasis) can occur in serotonin syndrome due to increased sympathetic activity.
explanations.tile_7: Tachycardia is a common sign of serotonin syndrome, reflecting autonomic nervous system overactivity.
explanations.tile_8: High body temperature (hyperthermia) can occur in severe cases of serotonin syndrome, due to increased muscle activity.
